Director: Ruggero Jacobbi
Year: 1951
Runtime: 88 min
Country: Brazil
Language: Portuguese
Subtitles: None
Color: Black and White
Company: CinematogrÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡fica Maristela

Presence of Anita was the first film produced by Film Maristela. The first was a story well chosen, based on one of the most talked about books of the moment - even considered scandalous by many people - the best-selling book titled John Donato, his argument - the uncontrollable passion of a painter since the age lobe by a teenager as beautiful as irresistible - that was conducive to impose a production model like the Italian neo-realism as its makers wanted, or leased equipment, finish and many exterior scenes (than was absolutely necessary) also in the studio hired, more precisely, the disclosure Film Pioneers.

Presence of Anita, is a film that, if the viewer a little closer, he could quietly be confused with any production of Vera Cruz, just the way it was filmed, with tics, more than evident, the productions vera-Cruziana.

Produced by Mario Civelli, directed by Ruggero Jacobbi and several technicians with strange surnames involved in production (Giorgi, Lesgards, PagÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©s, Altschuler, Tkazensko, Laurelli etc..), The film also had a slight cast, little known to the general public Generally, where underlined Orlando Villar, Antonieta Morineau, Armando Couto, Henriette Morineau, Vera Nunes, Guido Lazzarini and the presence of some actors who would later be well known, especially Elysium Albuquerque and Jaime Barcelos.

Intimate drama with a touch of the supernatural, the film tells the story of Edward (Orlando Villar, one of the heartthrobs of the time), designer tormented by the suicide of his mistress (Antonietta Morineau). Looking remake his life after being acquitted by the courts, it will eventually become involved with the sister without, however, can forget the past and the woman he loves. The film follows the conflict of Edward until his tragic outcome.
